definition: model worker
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
mold/die/matrix/pattern
to imitate/model/norm/pattern

sentences.english: The women model workers actively participate in local politics.
sentences.chinese: 這些女勞模積極參與當地政治。

sentences.english: The wealth of the enterprise model worker is the main force of enterprise security products.
sentences.chinese: 勞模是企業的財富，是企業安全生產的主力軍。

sentences.english: They held a party in honour of the model workers.
sentences.chinese: 他們舉行了一場晚會來向勞模們表示敬意。

sentences.english: In a word, we should learn from him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名勞模，我們應該向他學習。

sentences.english: I played against Ferrer, I played against Davydenko in the French Open.
sentences.chinese: 我打過費雷，法網對陣勞模。

sentences.english: On what he'll do with the prize money: "I want to buy apartment still."
sentences.chinese: 上面是勞模答記者問，誰說拿了獎金急着買房啦？

to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
to force someone to do something

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
to stir-fry leftover rice/fig. to rehash the same story/to serve up the same old product
shameful performance/disgraceful situation
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties

not one good point/everything about it is wrong
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
born at the wrong time (idiom); unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate)/born under an unlucky star/ahead of his time
to remain unmoved
